Detailed Description

Class: InstructionSet Design Pattern Used: Composite The Composite portion of the Composite pattern. This contains Instruction* children.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

void BabelShark::InstructionSet::Add ( Instruction *  instruction  )  [virtual]

Add Adds a child Instruction to the list. Standard add of the composite pattern

Reimplemented from BabelShark::InstructionNode.

Iterator * BabelShark::InstructionSet::CreateIterator (  )  [virtual]

CreateIterator This is taking the part of the ConcreteList in the iterator pattern Although we haven't done append/remove we don't need to since our list is static when we are iterating over it

Reimplemented from BabelShark::InstructionNode.

char * BabelShark::InstructionSet::Display (  )  [virtual]

Display For the instruction set this just prints out the name of the set the printing out of the names/content of the children will be handled by the dissector calling the display function one at a time for each child

Reimplemented from BabelShark::InstructionNode.

Instruction * BabelShark::InstructionSet::GetChild (  )  [virtual]

GetChild Returns the first Child of the InstructionSet list regardless of number of children present. This was mainly for testing for the presence of children but is no longer used May be taken out at some point in the future

Does not match the standard pattern definition since we're using an iterator instead

Reimplemented from BabelShark::InstructionNode.

unsigned int BabelShark::InstructionSet::GetSizeInBytes (  )  [virtual]

GetSizeInBytes Returns the sum of calling GetSizeInBytes on all children Override the function defined in instruction

Reimplemented from BabelShark::InstructionNode.

unsigned int BabelShark::InstructionSet::Interpret ( char *  buffer  )  [virtual]

Interpret Currently an empty function since the dissector will just look directly at the children

Reimplemented from BabelShark::InstructionNode.

unsigned int BabelShark::InstructionSet::NumSubtrees (  )  [virtual]

NumSubTrees Returns the sum of calling NumSubTrees on all children Override the [dummy] function defined in instruction
